info.description: This is the documentation for Honeybee model schema.
info.title: Honeybee Model Schema

u_factor.title: U Factor
u_factor.description: Used to describe the value for window system U-Factor, or overall heat transfer coefficient in W/(m2-K).

shgc.title: Shgc
shgc.description: Unitless  quantity describing Solar Heat Gain Coefficient for normal incidence and vertical orientation.

vt.title: Vt
vt.description: The fraction of visible light falling on the window that makes it through the glass at normal incidence.

EnergyWindowMaterialSimpleGlazSys.title: EnergyWindowMaterialSimpleGlazSys
EnergyWindowMaterialSimpleGlazSys.description:
Describe an entire glazing system rather than individual layers.

Used when only very limited information is available on the glazing layers or when
specific performance levels are being targeted.

ApertureEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: ApertureEnergyPropertiesAbridged
ApertureEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: Identifier of a WindowConstruction for the aperture. If None, the construction is set by the parent Room construction_set or the Model global_construction_set.

DoorEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: DoorEnergyPropertiesAbridged
DoorEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: Identifier of an OpaqueConstruction or WindowConstruction for the door. Note that the host door must have the is_glass property set to True to assign a WindowConstruction. If None, the construction is set by the parent Room construction_set or the Model global_construction_set.

DoorRadiancePropertiesAbridged.title: DoorRadiancePropertiesAbridged
DoorRadiancePropertiesAbridged.description: Radiance Properties for Honeybee Door Abridged.

flow_per_person.title: Flow Per Person
flow_per_person.description: Intensity of ventilation in[] m3/s per person]. Note that setting this value does not mean that ventilation is varied based on real-time occupancy but rather that the design level of ventilation is determined using this value and the People object of the Room.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Intensity of ventilation in [m3/s per m2 of floor area].

air_changes_per_hour.title: Air Changes Per Hour
air_changes_per_hour.description: Intensity of ventilation in air changes per hour (ACH) for the entire Room.

flow_per_zone.title: Flow Per Zone
flow_per_zone.description: Intensity of ventilation in m3/s for the entire Room.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the ventilation over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the total design flow rate (determined from the sum of the other 4 fields) to yield a complete ventilation profile.

VentilationAbridged.title: VentilationAbridged
VentilationAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

WallConstructionSetAbridged.description: A set of constructions for wall assemblies.

exterior_glass_construction.description: Identifier for a WindowConstruction for all glass doors with an Outdoors boundary condition.

interior_glass_construction.title: Interior Glass Construction
interior_glass_construction.description: Identifier for a WindowConstruction for all glass doors with a Surface boundary condition.

wall_set.description: A WallConstructionSetAbridged object for this ConstructionSet.

floor_set.title: Floor Set
floor_set.description: A FloorConstructionSetAbridged object for this ConstructionSet.

roof_ceiling_set.title: Roof Ceiling Set
roof_ceiling_set.description: A RoofCeilingConstructionSetAbridged object for this ConstructionSet.

aperture_set.title: Aperture Set
aperture_set.description: A ApertureConstructionSetAbridged object for this ConstructionSet.

door_set.title: Door Set
door_set.description: A DoorConstructionSetAbridged object for this ConstructionSet.

shade_construction.title: Shade Construction
shade_construction.description: The identifier of a ShadeConstruction to set the reflectance properties of all outdoor shades of all objects to which this ConstructionSet is assigned.

air_boundary_construction.title: Air Boundary Construction
air_boundary_construction.description: The identifier of an AirBoundaryConstruction to set the properties of Faces with an AirBoundary type.

ConstructionSetAbridged.title: ConstructionSetAbridged
ConstructionSetAbridged.description: A set of constructions for different surface types and boundary conditions.

thickness.description: Thickness of the material layer in meters.

conductivity.title: Conductivity
conductivity.description: Thermal conductivity of the material layer in W/(m-K).

density.title: Density
density.description: Density of the material layer in kg/m3.

specific_heat.title: Specific Heat
specific_heat.description: Specific heat of the material layer in J/(kg-K).

thermal_absorptance.title: Thermal Absorptance
thermal_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.9.

solar_absorptance.title: Solar Absorptance
solar_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident solar radiation absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.7.

visible_absorptance.title: Visible Absorptance
visible_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.7.

EnergyMaterial.title: EnergyMaterial
EnergyMaterial.description: Opaque material representing a layer within an opaque construction.

r_value.title: R Value
r_value.description: The thermal resistance (R-value) of the material layer [m2-K/W].

thermal_absorptance.title: Thermal Absorptance
thermal_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.9.

solar_absorptance.title: Solar Absorptance
solar_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident solar radiation absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.7.

visible_absorptance.title: Visible Absorptance
visible_absorptance.description: Fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation absorbed by the material. Default value is 0.7.

EnergyMaterialNoMass.title: EnergyMaterialNoMass
EnergyMaterialNoMass.description:
No mass opaque material representing a layer within an opaque construction.

Used when only the thermal resistance (R value) of the material is known.

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: List of materials. The order of the materials is from outside to inside.

RoofCeilingConstructionSet.description: A set of constructions for roof and ceiling assemblies.

interior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Surface or Adiabatic boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with an Outdoors boundary condition.

ground_construction.title: Ground Construction
ground_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Ground boundary condition.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: Thickness of the gas layer in meters. Default value is 0.0125.

EnergyWindowMaterialGas.title: EnergyWindowMaterialGas
EnergyWindowMaterialGas.description:
Create single layer of gas in a window construction.

Can be combined with EnergyWindowMaterialGlazing to make multi-pane windows.

conductivity_coeff_a.title: Conductivity Coeff A
conductivity_coeff_a.description: The A coefficient for gas conductivity in W/(m-K).

viscosity_coeff_a.title: Viscosity Coeff A
viscosity_coeff_a.description: The A coefficient for gas viscosity in kg/(m-s).

specific_heat_coeff_a.title: Specific Heat Coeff A
specific_heat_coeff_a.description: The A coefficient for gas specific heat in J/(kg-K).

specific_heat_ratio.title: Specific Heat Ratio
specific_heat_ratio.description: The specific heat ratio for gas.

molecular_weight.title: Molecular Weight
molecular_weight.description: The molecular weight for gas in g/mol.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: Thickness of the gas layer in meters. Default value is 0.0125.

conductivity_coeff_b.title: Conductivity Coeff B
conductivity_coeff_b.description: The B coefficient for gas conductivity in W/(m-K2).

conductivity_coeff_c.title: Conductivity Coeff C
conductivity_coeff_c.description: The C coefficient for gas conductivity in W/(m-K3).

viscosity_coeff_b.title: Viscosity Coeff B
viscosity_coeff_b.description: The B coefficient for gas viscosity in kg/(m-s-K).

viscosity_coeff_c.title: Viscosity Coeff C
viscosity_coeff_c.description: The C coefficient for gas viscosity in kg/(m-s-K2).

specific_heat_coeff_b.title: Specific Heat Coeff B
specific_heat_coeff_b.description: The B coefficient for gas specific heat in J/(kg-K2).

specific_heat_coeff_c.title: Specific Heat Coeff C
specific_heat_coeff_c.description: The C coefficient for gas specific heat in J/(kg-K3).

EnergyWindowMaterialGasCustom.title: EnergyWindowMaterialGasCustom
EnergyWindowMaterialGasCustom.description: Create single layer of custom gas.

gas_types.title: Gas Types
gas_types.description: List of gases in the gas mixture.

gas_fractions.title: Gas Fractions
gas_fractions.description: A list of fractional numbers describing the volumetric fractions of gas types in the mixture. This list must align with the gas_types list and must sum to 1.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: The thickness of the gas mixture layer in meters.

EnergyWindowMaterialGasMixture.title: EnergyWindowMaterialGasMixture
EnergyWindowMaterialGasMixture.description:
Create a mixture of two to four different gases to fill the panes of multiple
pane windows.

slat_width.title: Slat Width
slat_width.description: The width of slat measured from edge to edge in meters.

slat_separation.title: Slat Separation
slat_separation.description: The distance between the front of a slat and the back of the adjacent slat in meters.

slat_thickness.title: Slat Thickness
slat_thickness.description: The distance between the faces of a slat in meters. The default value is 0.001.

slat_angle.title: Slat Angle
slat_angle.description: The angle (degrees) between the glazing outward normal and the slat outward normal where the outward normal points away from the front face of the slat (degrees). The default value is 45.

slat_conductivity.title: Slat Conductivity
slat_conductivity.description: The thermal conductivity of the slat in W/(m-K). Default value is 221.

beam_solar_transmittance.title: Beam Solar Transmittance
beam_solar_transmittance.description: The beam solar transmittance of the slat, assumed to be independent of angle of incidence on the slat. Any transmitted beam radiation is assumed to be 100% diffuse (i.e., slats are translucent). The default value is 0.

beam_solar_reflectance.title: Beam Solar Reflectance
beam_solar_reflectance.description: The beam solar reflectance of the front side of the slat, it is assumed to be independent of the angle of incidence. Default value is 0.5.

beam_solar_reflectance_back.title: Beam Solar Reflectance Back
beam_solar_reflectance_back.description: The beam solar reflectance of the back side of the slat, it is assumed to be independent of the angle of incidence. Default value is 0.5.

diffuse_solar_transmittance.title: Diffuse Solar Transmittance
diffuse_solar_transmittance.description: The slat transmittance for hemisperically diffuse solar radiation. Default value is 0.

diffuse_solar_reflectance.title: Diffuse Solar Reflectance
diffuse_solar_reflectance.description: The front-side slat reflectance for hemispherically diffuse solar radiation. Default value is 0.5.

diffuse_solar_reflectance_back.title: Diffuse Solar Reflectance Back
diffuse_solar_reflectance_back.description: The back-side slat reflectance for hemispherically diffuse solar radiation. Default value is 0.5.

beam_visible_transmittance.title: Beam Visible Transmittance
beam_visible_transmittance.description: The beam visible transmittance of the slat, it is assumed to be independent of the angle of incidence. Default value is 0.

beam_visible_reflectance.title: Beam Visible Reflectance
beam_visible_reflectance.description: The beam visible reflectance on the front side of the slat, it is assumed to be independent of the angle of incidence. Default value is 0.5.

beam_visible_reflectance_back.title: Beam Visible Reflectance Back
beam_visible_reflectance_back.description: The beam visible reflectance on the back side of the slat, it is assumed to be independent of the angle of incidence. Default value is 0.5.

diffuse_visible_transmittance.title: Diffuse Visible Transmittance
diffuse_visible_transmittance.description: The slat transmittance for hemispherically diffuse visible radiation. This value should equal “Slat Beam Visible Transmittance.”

diffuse_visible_reflectance.title: Diffuse Visible Reflectance
diffuse_visible_reflectance.description: The front-side slat reflectance for hemispherically diffuse visible radiation. This value should equal “Front Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance.” Default value is 0.5.

diffuse_visible_reflectance_back.title: Diffuse Visible Reflectance Back
diffuse_visible_reflectance_back.description: The back-side slat reflectance for hemispherically diffuse visible radiation. This value should equal “Back Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance. Default value is 0.5.”

infrared_transmittance.title: Infrared Transmittance
infrared_transmittance.description: The slat infrared hemispherical transmittance. It is zero for solid metallic, wooden or glass slats, but may be non-zero in some cases such as for thin plastic slats. The default value is 0.

emissivity.title: Emissivity
emissivity.description: Front side hemispherical emissivity of the slat. Default is 0.9 for most materials. The default value is 0.9.

emissivity_back.title: Emissivity Back
emissivity_back.description: Back side hemispherical emissivity of the slat. Default is 0.9 for most materials. The default value is 0.9.

distance_to_glass.title: Distance To Glass
distance_to_glass.description: The distance from the mid-plane of the blind to the adjacent glass in meters. The default value is 0.05.

top_opening_multiplier.title: Top Opening Multiplier
top_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the top of the shade, divided by the horizontal area between glass and shade. The default value is 0.5

bottom_opening_multiplier.title: Bottom Opening Multiplier
bottom_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the bottom of the shade, divided by the horizontal area between glass and shade. The default value is 0.

left_opening_multiplier.title: Left Opening Multiplier
left_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the left side of the shade, divided by the vertical area between glass and shade. The default value is 0.5.

right_opening_multiplier.title: Right Opening Multiplier
right_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the right side of the shade, divided by the vertical area between glass and shade. The default value is 0.5.

EnergyWindowMaterialBlind.title: EnergyWindowMaterialBlind
EnergyWindowMaterialBlind.description: Window blind material consisting of flat, equally-spaced slats.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: The surface-to-surface of the glass in meters. Default value is 0.003.

solar_transmittance.title: Solar Transmittance
solar_transmittance.description: Transmittance of solar radiation through the glass at normal incidence. Default value is 0.85 for clear glass.

solar_reflectance.title: Solar Reflectance
solar_reflectance.description: Reflectance of solar radiation off of the front side of the glass at normal incidence, averaged over the solar spectrum. Default value is 0.075 for clear glass.

solar_reflectance_back.title: Solar Reflectance Back
solar_reflectance_back.description: Reflectance of solar radiation off of the back side of the glass at normal incidence, averaged over the solar spectrum.

visible_transmittance.title: Visible Transmittance
visible_transmittance.description: Transmittance of visible light through the glass at normal incidence. Default value is 0.9 for clear glass.

visible_reflectance.title: Visible Reflectance
visible_reflectance.description: Reflectance of visible light off of the front side of the glass at normal incidence. Default value is 0.075 for clear glass.

visible_reflectance_back.title: Visible Reflectance Back
visible_reflectance_back.description: Reflectance of visible light off of the back side of the glass at normal incidence averaged over the solar spectrum and weighted by the response of the human eye.

emissivity.title: Emissivity
emissivity.description: Infrared hemispherical emissivity of the front (outward facing) side of the glass.  Default value is 0.84, which is typical for clear glass without a low-e coating.

emissivity_back.title: Emissivity Back
emissivity_back.description: Infrared hemispherical emissivity of the back (inward facing) side of the glass.  Default value is 0.84, which is typical for clear glass without a low-e coating.

conductivity.title: Conductivity
conductivity.description: Thermal conductivity of the glass in W/(m-K). Default value is 0.9, which is  typical for clear glass without a low-e coating.

dirt_correction.title: Dirt Correction
dirt_correction.description: Factor that corrects for the presence of dirt on the glass. A default value of 1 indicates the glass is clean.

solar_diffusing.title: Solar Diffusing
solar_diffusing.description: Takes values True and False. If False (default), the beam solar radiation incident on the glass is transmitted as beam radiation with no diffuse component.If True, the beam  solar radiation incident on the glass is transmitted as hemispherical diffuse radiation with no beam component.

EnergyWindowMaterialGlazing.title: EnergyWindowMaterialGlazing
EnergyWindowMaterialGlazing.description: Describe a single glass pane corresponding to a layer in a window construction.

solar_transmittance.title: Solar Transmittance
solar_transmittance.description: The transmittance averaged over the solar spectrum. It is assumed independent of incidence angle. Default value is 0.4.

solar_reflectance.title: Solar Reflectance
solar_reflectance.description: The reflectance averaged over the solar spectrum. It us assumed same on both sides of shade and independent of incidence angle. Default value is 0.5

visible_transmittance.title: Visible Transmittance
visible_transmittance.description: The transmittance averaged over the solar spectrum and weighted by the response of the human eye. It is assumed independent of incidence angle. Default value is 0.4.

visible_reflectance.title: Visible Reflectance
visible_reflectance.description: The transmittance averaged over the solar spectrum and weighted by the response of the human eye. It is assumed independent of incidence angle. Default value is 0.4

emissivity.title: Emissivity
emissivity.description: The effective long-wave infrared hemispherical emissivity. It is assumed same on both sides of shade. Default value is 0.9.

infrared_transmittance.title: Infrared Transmittance
infrared_transmittance.description: The effective long-wave transmittance. It is assumed independent of incidence angle. Default value is 0.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: The thickness of the shade material in meters. Default value is 0.005.

conductivity.title: Conductivity
conductivity.description: The conductivity of the shade material in W/(m-K). Default value is 0.1.

distance_to_glass.title: Distance To Glass
distance_to_glass.description: The distance from shade to adjacent glass in meters. Default value is 0.05

top_opening_multiplier.title: Top Opening Multiplier
top_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the top of the shade, divided by the horizontal area between glass and shade. Default value is 0.5.

bottom_opening_multiplier.title: Bottom Opening Multiplier
bottom_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the bottom of the shade, divided by the horizontal area between glass and shade. Default value is 0.5.

left_opening_multiplier.title: Left Opening Multiplier
left_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the left side of the shade, divided by the vertical area between glass and shade. Default value is 0.5.

right_opening_multiplier.title: Right Opening Multiplier
right_opening_multiplier.description: The effective area for air flow at the right side of the shade, divided by the vertical area between glass and shade. Default value is 0.5.

airflow_permeability.title: Airflow Permeability
airflow_permeability.description: The fraction of the shade surface that is open to air flow. If air cannot pass through the shade material, airflow_permeability = 0. Default value is 0.

EnergyWindowMaterialShade.title: EnergyWindowMaterialShade
EnergyWindowMaterialShade.description: This object specifies the properties of window shade materials.

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: List of materials. The order of the materials is from outside to inside.

ApertureConstructionSet.title: ApertureConstructionSet
ApertureConstructionSet.description: A set of constructions for aperture assemblies.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for apertures with an Outdoors boundary condition, False is_operable property, and a Wall face type for their parent face.

window_construction.title: Window Construction
window_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for all apertures with a Surface boundary condition.

skylight_construction.title: Skylight Construction
skylight_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for apertures with a Outdoors boundary condition, False is_operable property, and a RoofCeiling or Floor face type for their parent face.

operable_construction.title: Operable Construction
operable_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for all apertures with an Outdoors boundary condition and True is_operable property..

DoorConstructionSet.title: DoorConstructionSet
DoorConstructionSet.description: A set of constructions for door assemblies.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for all opaque doors with a Surface boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for opaque doors with an Outdoors boundary condition and a Wall face type for their parent face.

overhead_construction.title: Overhead Construction
overhead_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for opaque doors with an Outdoors boundary condition and a RoofCeiling or Floor type for their parent face.

exterior_glass_construction.title: Exterior Glass Construction
exterior_glass_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for all glass doors with an Outdoors boundary condition.

interior_glass_construction.title: Interior Glass Construction
interior_glass_construction.description: A WindowConstruction for all glass doors with a Surface boundary condition.

solar_reflectance.title: Solar Reflectance
solar_reflectance.description: A number for the solar reflectance of the construction.

visible_reflectance.title: Visible Reflectance
visible_reflectance.description: A number for the visible reflectance of the construction.

is_specular.title: Is Specular
is_specular.description: Boolean to note whether the reflection off the shade is diffuse (False) or specular (True). Set to True if the construction is representing a glass facade or a mirror material.

values.title: Values
values.description: A list of floats or integers for the values of the schedule. The length of this list must match the length of the times list.

times.title: Times
times.description: A list of lists with each sub-list possesing 2 values for [hour, minute]. The length of the master list must match the length of the values list. Each time in the master list represents the time of day that the corresponding value begins to take effect. For example [(0,0), (9,0), (17,0)] in combination with the values [0, 1, 0] denotes a schedule value of 0 from 0:00 to 9:00, a value of 1 from 9:00 to 17:00 and 0 from 17:00 to the end of the day. Note that this representation of times as the "time of beginning" is a different convention than EnergyPlus, which uses "time until".

interpolate.title: Interpolate
interpolate.description: Boolean to note whether values in between times should be linearly interpolated or whether successive values should take effect immediately upon the beginning time corrsponding to them.

ScheduleDay.title: ScheduleDay
ScheduleDay.description: Used to describe the daily schedule for a single simulation day.

schedule_day.title: Schedule Day
schedule_day.description: The identifier of a ScheduleDay object associated with this rule.

apply_sunday.title: Apply Sunday
apply_sunday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Sundays.

apply_monday.title: Apply Monday
apply_monday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Mondays.

apply_tuesday.title: Apply Tuesday
apply_tuesday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Tuesdays.

apply_wednesday.title: Apply Wednesday
apply_wednesday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Wednesdays.

apply_thursday.title: Apply Thursday
apply_thursday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Thursdays.

apply_friday.title: Apply Friday
apply_friday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Fridays.

apply_saturday.title: Apply Saturday
apply_saturday.description: Boolean noting whether to apply schedule_day on Saturdays.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: A list of two integers for [month, day], representing the start date of the period over which the schedule_day will be applied.A third integer may be added to denote whether the date should be re-serialized for a leap year (it should be a 1 in this case).

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: A list of two integers for [month, day], representing the end date of the period over which the schedule_day will be applied.A third integer may be added to denote whether the date should be re-serialized for a leap year (it should be a 1 in this case).

ScheduleRuleAbridged.title: ScheduleRuleAbridged
ScheduleRuleAbridged.description: Schedule rule including a ScheduleDay and when it should be applied..

NoLimit.title: NoLimit
NoLimit.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

lower_limit.title: Lower Limit
lower_limit.description: Lower limit for the schedule type or NoLimit.

upper_limit.title: Upper Limit
upper_limit.description: Upper limit for the schedule type or NoLimit.

ScheduleTypeLimit.title: ScheduleTypeLimit
ScheduleTypeLimit.description: Specifies the data types and limits for values contained in schedules.

day_schedules.title: Day Schedules
day_schedules.description: A list of ScheduleDays that are referenced in the other keys of this ScheduleRulesetAbridged.

default_day_schedule.title: Default Day Schedule
default_day_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for all days when no ScheduleRule is applied. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

schedule_rules.title: Schedule Rules
schedule_rules.description: A list of ScheduleRuleAbridged that note exceptions to the default_day_schedule. These rules should be ordered from highest to lowest priority.

holiday_schedule.title: Holiday Schedule
holiday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for holidays. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

summer_designday_schedule.title: Summer Designday Schedule
summer_designday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for the summer design day. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

winter_designday_schedule.title: Winter Designday Schedule
winter_designday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for the winter design day. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

schedule_type_limit.title: Schedule Type Limit
schedule_type_limit.description: ScheduleTypeLimit object that will be used to validate schedule values against upper/lower limits and assign units to the schedule values. If None, no validation will occur.

ScheduleRuleset.title: ScheduleRuleset
ScheduleRuleset.description: Used to define a schedule for a default day, further described by ScheduleRule.

values.title: Values
values.description: A list of timeseries values occuring at each timestep over the course of the simulation.

schedule_type_limit.title: Schedule Type Limit
schedule_type_limit.description: ScheduleTypeLimit object that will be used to validate schedule values against upper/lower limits and assign units to the schedule values. If None, no validation will occur.

timestep.title: Timestep
timestep.description: An integer for the number of steps per hour that the input values correspond to.  For example, if each value represents 30 minutes, the timestep is 2. For 15 minutes, it is 4.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: A list of two integers for [month, day], representing the start date when the schedule values begin to take effect.A third integer may be added to denote whether the date should be re-serialized for a leap year (it should be a 1 in this case).

placeholder_value.title: Placeholder Value
placeholder_value.description: A value that will be used for all times not covered by the input values. Typically, your simulation should not need to use this value if the input values completely cover the simulation period.

interpolate.title: Interpolate
interpolate.description: Boolean to note whether values in between intervals should be linearly interpolated or whether successive values should take effect immediately upon the beginning time corrsponding to them.

ScheduleFixedInterval.title: ScheduleFixedInterval
ScheduleFixedInterval.description: Used to specify a start date and a list of values for a period of analysis.

air_mixing_schedule.title: Air Mixing Schedule
air_mixing_schedule.description: A fractional schedule as a ScheduleRuleset or ScheduleFixedInterval for the air mixing schedule across the construction.

air_mixing_per_area.title: Air Mixing Per Area
air_mixing_per_area.description: A positive number for the amount of air mixing between Rooms across the air boundary surface [m3/s-m2]. Default: 0.1 corresponds to average indoor air speeds of 0.1 m/s (roughly 20 fpm), which is typical of what would be induced by a HVAC system.

wall_set.title: Wall Set
wall_set.description: A WallConstructionSet object for this ConstructionSet.

floor_set.title: Floor Set
floor_set.description: A FloorConstructionSet object for this ConstructionSet.

roof_ceiling_set.title: Roof Ceiling Set
roof_ceiling_set.description: A RoofCeilingConstructionSet object for this ConstructionSet.

aperture_set.title: Aperture Set
aperture_set.description: A ApertureConstructionSet object for this ConstructionSet.

door_set.title: Door Set
door_set.description: A DoorConstructionSet object for this ConstructionSet.

shade_construction.title: Shade Construction
shade_construction.description: A ShadeConstruction to set the reflectance properties of all outdoor shades of all objects to which this ConstructionSet is assigned.

air_boundary_construction.title: Air Boundary Construction
air_boundary_construction.description: An AirBoundaryConstruction to set the properties of Faces with an AirBoundary type.

ConstructionSet.title: ConstructionSet
ConstructionSet.description: A set of constructions for different surface types and boundary conditions.

layers.title: Layers
layers.description: List of strings for material identifiers. The order of the materials is from exterior to interior.

OpaqueConstructionAbridged.title: OpaqueConstructionAbridged
OpaqueConstructionAbridged.description: Construction for opaque objects (Face, Shade, Door).

layers.title: Layers
layers.description: List of strings for material identifiers. The order of the materials is from exterior to interior.

air_mixing_schedule.title: Air Mixing Schedule
air_mixing_schedule.description: Identifier of a fractional schedule for the air mixing schedule across the construction.

air_mixing_per_area.title: Air Mixing Per Area
air_mixing_per_area.description: A positive number for the amount of air mixing between Rooms across the air boundary surface [m3/s-m2]. Default: 0.1 corresponds to average indoor air speeds of 0.1 m/s (roughly 20 fpm), which is typical of what would be induced by a HVAC system.

Autosize.title: Autosize
Autosize.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

economizer_type.title: Economizer Type
economizer_type.description: Text to indicate the type of air-side economizer used on the ideal air system. Economizers will mix in a greater amount of outdoor air to cool the zone (rather than running the cooling system) when the zone needs cooling and the outdoor air is cooler than the zone.

demand_controlled_ventilation.title: Demand Controlled Ventilation
demand_controlled_ventilation.description: Boolean to note whether demand controlled ventilation should be used on the system, which will vary the amount of ventilation air according to the occupancy schedule of the zone.

sensible_heat_recovery.title: Sensible Heat Recovery
sensible_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of sensible heat recovery within the system.

latent_heat_recovery.title: Latent Heat Recovery
latent_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of latent heat recovery within the system.

heating_air_temperature.title: Heating Air Temperature
heating_air_temperature.description: A number for the maximum heating supply air temperature [C].

cooling_air_temperature.title: Cooling Air Temperature
cooling_air_temperature.description: A number for the minimum cooling supply air temperature [C].

heating_limit.title: Heating Limit
heating_limit.description: A number for the maximum heating capacity in Watts. This can also be an Autosize object to indicate that the capacity should be determined during the EnergyPlus sizing calculation. This can also be a NoLimit boject to indicate no upper limit to the heating capacity.

cooling_limit.title: Cooling Limit
cooling_limit.description: A number for the maximum cooling capacity in Watts. This can also be an Autosize object to indicate that the capacity should be determined during the EnergyPlus sizing calculation. This can also be a NoLimit boject to indicate no upper limit to the cooling capacity.

heating_availability.title: Heating Availability
heating_availability.description: An optional identifier of a schedule to set the availability of heating over the course of the simulation.

cooling_availability.title: Cooling Availability
cooling_availability.description: An optional identifier of a schedule to set the availability of cooling over the course of the simulation.

IdealAirSystemAbridged.title: IdealAirSystemAbridged
IdealAirSystemAbridged.description: Provides a model for an ideal HVAC system.

Autocalculate.title: Autocalculate
Autocalculate.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

people_per_area.title: People Per Area
people_per_area.description: People per floor area expressed as [people/m2]

occupancy_schedule.title: Occupancy Schedule
occupancy_schedule.description: Identifier of a schedule for the occupancy over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the people_per_area to yield a complete occupancy profile.

activity_schedule.title: Activity Schedule
activity_schedule.description: Identifier of a schedule for the activity of the occupants over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Power and the values of the schedule equal to the number of Watts given off by an individual person in the room.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The radiant fraction of sensible heat released by people. The defaultvalue is 0.30.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the latent fraction of heat gain due to people or an Autocalculate object.

PeopleAbridged.title: PeopleAbridged
PeopleAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the use of lights over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete lighting profile.

visible_fraction.title: Visible Fraction
visible_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that goes into the zone as visible (short-wave) radiation. The default value is `0.25`.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that is long-wave radiation. Default value is `0.32`.

return_air_fraction.title: Return Air Fraction
return_air_fraction.description: The fraction of the heat from lights that goes into the zone return air. Default value is `0`.

LightingAbridged.title: LightingAbridged
LightingAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

ElectricEquipmentAbridged.title: ElectricEquipmentAbridged
ElectricEquipmentAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

GasEquipmentAbridged.title: GasEquipmentAbridged
GasEquipmentAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

flow_per_exterior_area.title: Flow Per Exterior Area
flow_per_exterior_area.description: Number for the infiltration per exterior surface area in m3/s-m2.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the infiltration over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the flow_per_exterior_area to yield a complete infiltration profile.

InfiltrationAbridged.title: InfiltrationAbridged
InfiltrationAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

cooling_schedule.title: Cooling Schedule
cooling_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the cooling setpoint. The values in this schedule should be temperature in [C].

heating_schedule.title: Heating Schedule
heating_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the heating setpoint. The values in this schedule should be temperature in [C].

humidifying_schedule.title: Humidifying Schedule
humidifying_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the humidification setpoint. The values in this schedule should be in [%].

dehumidifying_schedule.title: Dehumidifying Schedule
dehumidifying_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the dehumidification setpoint. The values in this schedule should be in [%].

SetpointAbridged.title: SetpointAbridged
SetpointAbridged.description: Used to specify information about the setpoint schedule.

people.title: People
people.description: People to describe the occupancy of the program. If None, no occupancy will be assumed for the program.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.description: Lighting to describe the lighting usage of the program. If None, no lighting will be assumed for the program.

electric_equipment.title: Electric Equipment
electric_equipment.description: ElectricEquipment to describe the usage of electric equipment within the program. If None, no electric equipment will be assumed.

gas_equipment.title: Gas Equipment
gas_equipment.description: GasEquipment to describe the usage of gas equipment within the program. If None, no gas equipment will be assumed.

infiltration.title: Infiltration
infiltration.description: Infiltration to describe the outdoor air leakage of the program. If None, no infiltration will be assumed for the program.

ventilation.title: Ventilation
ventilation.description: Ventilation to describe the minimum outdoor air requirement of the program. If None, no ventilation requirement will be assumed.

setpoint.title: Setpoint
setpoint.description: Setpoint object to describe the temperature and humidity setpoints of the program.  If None, the ProgramType cannot be assigned to a Room that is conditioned.

ProgramTypeAbridged.title: ProgramTypeAbridged
ProgramTypeAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

schedule.description: The schedule for the use of equipment over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete equipment profile.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction

flow_per_person.title: Flow Per Person
flow_per_person.description: Intensity of ventilation in[] m3/s per person]. Note that setting this value does not mean that ventilation is varied based on real-time occupancy but rather that the design level of ventilation is determined using this value and the People object of the Room.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Intensity of ventilation in [m3/s per m2 of floor area].

air_changes_per_hour.title: Air Changes Per Hour
air_changes_per_hour.description: Intensity of ventilation in air changes per hour (ACH) for the entire Room.

flow_per_zone.title: Flow Per Zone
flow_per_zone.description: Intensity of ventilation in m3/s for the entire Room.

schedule.description: Schedule for the ventilation over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the total design flow rate (determined from the sum of the other 4 fields) to yield a complete ventilation profile.

day_schedules.title: Day Schedules
day_schedules.description: A list of ScheduleDays that are referenced in the other keys of this ScheduleRulesetAbridged.

default_day_schedule.title: Default Day Schedule
default_day_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for all days when no ScheduleRule is applied. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

schedule_rules.title: Schedule Rules
schedule_rules.description: A list of ScheduleRuleAbridged that note exceptions to the default_day_schedule. These rules should be ordered from highest to lowest priority.

holiday_schedule.title: Holiday Schedule

schedule_type_limit.description: Identifier of a ScheduleTypeLimit that will be used to validate schedule values against upper/lower limits and assign units to the schedule values. If None, no validation will occur.

ScheduleRulesetAbridged.description: Used to define a schedule for a default day, further described by ScheduleRule.

interpolate.title: Interpolate

ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged.title: ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged
ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged.description: Used to specify a start date and a list of values for a period of analysis.

ModelEnergyProperties.title: ModelEnergyProperties
ModelEnergyProperties.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

terrain_type.title: Terrain Type
terrain_type.description: Text for the terrain in which the model sits. This is used to determine the wind profile over the height of the rooms.

global_construction_set.title: Global Construction Set
global_construction_set.description: Identifier for the ConstructionSet to be used for all objects lacking their own construction or a parent Room construction_set. This ConstructionSet must appear under the Model construction_sets.

construction_sets.title: Construction Sets
construction_sets.description: List of all unique ConstructionSets in the Model.

constructions.title: Constructions
constructions.description: A list of all unique constructions in the model. This includes constructions across all Faces, Apertures, Doors, Shades, Room ConstructionSets, and the global_construction_set.

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: A list of all unique materials in the model. This includes materials needed to make the Model constructions.

hvacs.title: Hvacs
hvacs.description: List of all unique HVAC systems in the Model.

program_types.title: Program Types
program_types.description: List of all unique ProgramTypes in the Model.

schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: A list of all unique schedules in the model. This includes schedules across all HVAC systems, ProgramTypes, Rooms, and Shades.

schedule_type_limits.title: Schedule Type Limits
schedule_type_limits.description: A list of all unique ScheduleTypeLimits in the model. This all ScheduleTypeLimits needed to make the Model schedules.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: List of modifiers that this modifier depends on. This argument is only useful for defining advanced modifiers where the modifier is defined based on other modifiers (default: []).

r_reflectance.title: R Reflectance
r_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the red channel reflectance (default: 1).

g_reflectance.title: G Reflectance
g_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the green channel reflectance (default: 1).

b_reflectance.title: B Reflectance
b_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the blue channel reflectance (default: 1).

alternate_material.title: Alternate Material
alternate_material.description: An optional material that may be used like the illum type to specify a different material to be used for shading non-source rays. If None, this will keep the alternat_material as mirror. If this alternate material is given as Void, then the mirror surface will be invisible. Using Void is only appropriate if the surface hides other (more detailed) geometry with the same overall reflectance (default: None).

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: List of modifiers that this modifier depends on. This argument is only useful for defining advanced modifiers where the modifier is defined based on other modifiers (default: []).

r_reflectance.title: R Reflectance
r_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the red channel reflectance (default: 0).

g_reflectance.title: G Reflectance
g_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the green channel reflectance (default: 0).

b_reflectance.title: B Reflectance
b_reflectance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the blue channel reflectance (default: 0).

specularity.title: Specularity
specularity.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the fraction of specularity. Specularity fractions greater than 0.1 are not realistic. (default: 0).

roughness.title: Roughness
roughness.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the roughness, specified as the rms slope of surface facets. Roughness greater than 0.2 are not realistic (default: 0).

transmitted_diff.title: Transmitted Diff
transmitted_diff.description: The fraction of transmitted light that is transmitted diffusely in a scattering fashion (default: 0).

transmitted_spec.title: Transmitted Spec
transmitted_spec.description: The fraction of transmitted light that is not diffusely scattered (default: 0).

b_emittance.title: B Emittance
b_emittance.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the blue channel of the modifier (default: 0).

max_radius.title: Max Radius
max_radius.description: Maximum radius for shadow testing (default: 0). Surfaces with zero will never be tested for zero, although it may participate in interreflection calculation. Negative values will never contribute to scene illumination.

bsdf_data.title: Bsdf Data
bsdf_data.description: BSDF xml file data as bytes.

dependencies.title: Dependencies

up_orientation.title: Up Orientation
up_orientation.description: Vector as sequence that sets the hemisphere that the BSDF material faces. (default: (0.01, 0.01, 1.00).

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.description: Optional number to set the thickness of the BSDF material Sign of thickness indicates whether proxied geometry is behind the BSDF surface (when thickness is positive) or in front (when thickness is negative)(default: 0).

transform.title: Transform
transform.description: Optional transform input to scale the thickness and reorient the up vector (default: None).

front_diffuse_reflectance.title: Front Diffuse Reflectance
front_diffuse_reflectance.description: Optional additional front diffuse reflectance as sequence of numbers (default: None).

back_diffuse_reflectance.title: Back Diffuse Reflectance

diffuse_transmittance.title: Diffuse Transmittance
diffuse_transmittance.description: Optional additional diffuse transmittance as sequence of numbers (default: None).

specularity.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the fraction of specularity. Specularity fractions greater than 0.1 are not realistic. (default: 0).

roughness.title: Roughness
roughness.description: A value between 0 and 1 for the roughness, specified as the rms slope of surface facets. Roughness greater than 0.2 are not realistic (default: 0).

air_boundary_modifier.description: An optional Modifier to be used for all Faces with an AirBoundary face type. If None, it will be the honyebee generic air wall modifier.

modifiers.title: Modifiers
modifiers.description: A list of all unique modifiers in the model. This includes modifiers across all Faces, Apertures, Doors, Shades, Room ModifierSets, and the global_modifier_set. (default: []).

modifier_sets.title: Modifier Sets
modifier_sets.description: A list of all unique Room-Assigned ModifierSets in the Model (default: []).

global_modifier_set.title: Global Modifier Set
global_modifier_set.description: Identifier of a ModifierSet or ModifierSetAbridged object to be used as as a default object for all unassigned objects in the Model (default: None).

Adiabatic.title: Adiabatic
Adiabatic.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

Surface.title: Surface
Surface.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

boundary_condition_objects.title: Boundary Condition Objects
boundary_condition_objects.description: A list of up to 3 object identifiers that are adjacent to this one. The first object is always the one that is immediately adjacet and is of the same object type (Face, Aperture, Door). When this boundary condition is applied to a Face, the second object in the tuple will be the parent Room of the adjacent object. When the boundary condition is applied to a sub-face (Door or Aperture), the second object will be the parent Face of the adjacent sub-face and the third object will be the parent Room of the adjacent sub-face.

ShadeEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: ShadeEnergyPropertiesAbridged
ShadeEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: Identifier of a ShadeConstruction to set the reflectance and specularity of the Shade. If None, the construction is set by theparent Room construction_set, the Model global_construction_set or (in the case fo an orphaned shade) the EnergyPlus default of 0.2 diffuse reflectance.

transmittance_schedule.title: Transmittance Schedule
transmittance_schedule.description: Identifier of a schedule to set the transmittance of the shade, which can vary throughout the simulation. If None, the shade will be completely opauqe.

ShadeRadiancePropertiesAbridged.title: ShadeRadiancePropertiesAbridged
ShadeRadiancePropertiesAbridged.description: Radiance Properties for Honeybee Shade Abridged.

Plane.title: Plane
Plane.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

n.title: N
n.description: Plane normal as 3 (x, y, z) values.

o.title: O
o.description: Plane origin as 3 (x, y, z) values

x.title: X
x.description: Plane x-axis as 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it is autocalculated.

Face3D.title: Face3D
Face3D.description: A single planar face in 3D space.

boundary.title: Boundary
boundary.description: A list of points representing the outer boundary vertices of the face. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

holes.title: Holes
holes.description: Optional list of lists with one list for each hole in the face.Each hole should be a list of at least 3 points and each point a list of 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it will be assumed that there are no holes in the face.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: Optional Plane indicating the plane in which the face exists.If None, the plane will usually be derived from the boundary points.

Ground.title: Ground
Ground.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

Outdoors.title: Outdoors
Outdoors.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

sun_exposure.title: Sun Exposure
sun_exposure.description: A boolean noting whether the boundary is exposed to sun.

wind_exposure.title: Wind Exposure
wind_exposure.description: A boolean noting whether the boundary is exposed to wind.

view_factor.title: View Factor
view_factor.description: A number for the view factor to the ground. This can also be an Autocalculate object to have the view factor automatically calculated.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

Shade.title: Shade
Shade.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

ApertureRadiancePropertiesAbridged.title: ApertureRadiancePropertiesAbridged
ApertureRadiancePropertiesAbridged.description: Radiance Properties for Honeybee Aperture Abridged.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

is_operable.title: Is Operable
is_operable.description: Boolean to note whether the Aperture can be opened for ventilation.

indoor_shades.title: Indoor Shades
indoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the interior side of this object (eg. window sill, light shelf).

outdoor_shades.title: Outdoor Shades
outdoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the exterior side of this object (eg. mullions, louvers).

Aperture.title: Aperture
Aperture.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

is_glass.title: Is Glass
is_glass.description: Boolean to note whether this object is a glass door as opposed to an opaque door.

indoor_shades.title: Indoor Shades
indoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the interior side of this object.

outdoor_shades.title: Outdoor Shades
outdoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the exterior side of this object (eg. entryway awning).

Door.title: Door
Door.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

FaceEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: FaceEnergyPropertiesAbridged
FaceEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: Identifier of an OpaqueConstruction for the Face. If None, the construction is set by the parent Room construction_set or the Model global_construction_set.

FaceRadiancePropertiesAbridged.title: FaceRadiancePropertiesAbridged
FaceRadiancePropertiesAbridged.description: Radiance Properties for Honeybee Face Abridged.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

apertures.title: Apertures
apertures.description: Apertures assigned to this Face. Should be coplanar with this Face and completely within the boundary of the Face to be valid.

doors.title: Doors
doors.description: Doors assigned to this Face. Should be coplanar with this Face and completely within the boundary of the Face to be valid.

indoor_shades.title: Indoor Shades
indoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the interior side of this object.

outdoor_shades.title: Outdoor Shades
outdoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the exterior side of this object (eg. balcony, overhang).

Face.title: Face
Face.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

RoomRadiancePropertiesAbridged.title: RoomRadiancePropertiesAbridged
RoomRadiancePropertiesAbridged.description: Abridged Radiance Properties for Honeybee Room.

modifier_set.title: Modifier Set
modifier_set.description: An identifier for a unique Room-Assigned ModifierSet (default: None).

RoomEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: RoomEnergyPropertiesAbridged
RoomEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

construction_set.title: Construction Set
construction_set.description: Identifier of a ConstructionSet to specify all default constructions for the Faces, Apertures, and Doors of the Room. If None, the Room will use the Model global_construction_set.

program_type.title: Program Type
program_type.description: Identifier of a ProgramType to specify all default schedules and loads for the Room. If None, the Room will have no loads or setpoints.

hvac.title: Hvac
hvac.description: An optional identifier of a HVAC system (such as an IdealAirSystem) that specifies how the Room is conditioned. If None, it will be assumed that the Room is not conditioned.

people.title: People
people.description: People object to describe the occupancy of the Room.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.description: Lighting object to describe the lighting usage of the Room.

electric_equipment.title: Electric Equipment
electric_equipment.description: ElectricEquipment object to describe the electric equipment usage.

gas_equipment.title: Gas Equipment
gas_equipment.description: GasEquipment object to describe the gas equipment usage.

infiltration.title: Infiltration
infiltration.description: Infiltration object to to describe the outdoor air leakage.

ventilation.title: Ventilation
ventilation.description: Ventilation object for the minimum outdoor air requirement.

setpoint.title: Setpoint
setpoint.description: Setpoint object for the temperature setpoints of the Room.

faces.title: Faces
faces.description: Faces that together form the closed volume of a room.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

indoor_shades.title: Indoor Shades
indoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the interior side of this object (eg. partitions, tables).

outdoor_shades.title: Outdoor Shades
outdoor_shades.description: Shades assigned to the exterior side of this object (eg. trees, landscaping).

multiplier.title: Multiplier
multiplier.description: An integer noting how many times this Room is repeated. Multipliers are used to speed up the calculation when similar Rooms are repeated more than once. Essentially, a given simulation with the Room is run once and then the result is mutliplied by the multiplier.

Room.title: Room
Room.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

rooms.title: Rooms
rooms.description: A list of Rooms in the model.

orphaned_faces.title: Orphaned Faces
orphaned_faces.description: A list of Faces in the model that lack a parent Room. Note that orphaned Faces are not acceptable for Models that are to be exported for energy simulation.

orphaned_shades.title: Orphaned Shades
orphaned_shades.description: A list of Shades in the model that lack a parent.

orphaned_apertures.title: Orphaned Apertures
orphaned_apertures.description: A list of Apertures in the model that lack a parent Face. Note that orphaned Apertures are not acceptable for Models that are to be exported for energy simulation.

orphaned_doors.title: Orphaned Doors
orphaned_doors.description: A list of Doors in the model that lack a parent Face. Note that orphaned Doors are not acceptable for Models that are to be exported for energy simulation.

north_angle.title: North Angle
north_angle.description: The clockwise north direction in degrees.

units.title: Units
units.description: Text indicating the units in which the model geometry exists. This is used to scale the geometry to the correct units for simulation engines like EnergyPlus, which requires all geometry be in meters.

tolerance.title: Tolerance
tolerance.description: The maximum difference between x, y, and z values at which vertices are considered equivalent. This value should be in the Model units and it is used in a variety of checks, including checks for whether Room faces form a closed volume and subsequently correcting all face normals point outward from the Room. A value of 0 will result in no attempt to evaluate whether Room volumes are closed or check face direction. So it is recommended that this always be a positive number when such checks have not been performed on a Model. Typical tolerances for builing geometry range from 0.1 to 0.0001 depending on the units of the geometry.

angle_tolerance.title: Angle Tolerance
angle_tolerance.description: The max angle difference in degrees that vertices are allowed to differ from one another in order to consider them colinear. This value is used in a variety of checks, including checks for whether Room faces form a closed volume and subsequently correcting all face normals point outward from the Room. A value of 0 will result in no attempt to evaluate whether the Room volumes is closed or check face direction. So it is recommended that this always be a positive number when such checks have not been performed on a given Model. Typical tolerances for builing geometry are often around 1 degree.

Model.title: Model
Model.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

IDdEnergyBaseModel.title: IDdEnergyBaseModel
IDdEnergyBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique object ID. This identifier remains constant as the object is mutated, copied, and serialized to different formats (eg. dict, idf, osm). This identifier is also used to reference the object across a Model. It must be < 100 characters, use only ASCII characters and exclude (, ; ! \n \t).

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions.

_FaceSubSetAbridged.title: _FaceSubSetAbridged
_FaceSubSetAbridged.description: A set of constructions for wall, floor, or roof assemblies.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with a Surface or Adiabatic boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with an Outdoors boundary condition.

ground_construction.title: Ground Construction
ground_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with a Ground boundary condition.

watts_per_area.title: Watts Per Area
watts_per_area.description: Equipment level per floor area as [W/m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the use of equipment over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete equipment profile.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: Number for the amount of long-wave radiation heat given off by electric equipment. Default value is 0.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the amount of latent heat given off by electricequipment. Default value is 0.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction
lost_fraction.description: Number for the amount of “lost” heat being given off by equipment. The default value is 0.

_EquipmentBase.title: _EquipmentBase
_EquipmentBase.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

BaseModifierSetAbridged.title: BaseModifierSetAbridged
BaseModifierSetAbridged.description: Base class for the abridged modfier sets assigned to Faces.

exterior_modifier.title: Exterior Modifier
exterior_modifier.description: Identifier for a radiance modifier object for faces with an  Outdoors boundary condition.

interior_modifier.title: Interior Modifier
interior_modifier.description: Identifier for a radiance modifier object for faces with a boundary condition other than Outdoors.

BaseModifierSet.title: BaseModifierSet
BaseModifierSet.description: Base class for the modifier sets assigned to Faces.

exterior_modifier.title: Exterior Modifier
exterior_modifier.description: A radiance modifier object for faces with an Outdoors boundary condition.

interior_modifier.title: Interior Modifier
interior_modifier.description: A radiance modifier object for faces with a boundary condition other than Outdoors.

_PropertiesBaseAbridged.description: Base class of Abridged Radiance Properties.

modifier.title: Modifier
modifier.description: A string for a Honeybee Radiance Modifier.

modifier_blk.title: Modifier Blk
modifier_blk.description: A string for a Honeybee Radiance Modifier to be used in direct solar simulations and in isolation studies (assessingthe contribution of individual objects).

IDdRadianceBaseModel.title: IDdRadianceBaseModel
IDdRadianceBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid Radiance identifier.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique Radiance object. Must not contain spaces or special characters. This will be used to identify the object across a model and in the exported Radiance files.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions.

DatedBaseModel.title: DatedBaseModel
DatedBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects needing to check for a valid Date.

IDdBaseModel.title: IDdBaseModel
IDdBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique object ID. This identifier remains constant as the object is mutated, copied, and serialized to different formats (eg. dict, idf, rad). This identifier is also used to reference the object across a Model. It must be < 100 characters and not contain any spaces or special characters.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

_FaceSubSet.title: _FaceSubSet
_FaceSubSet.description: A set of constructions for wall, floor, or roof assemblies.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Surface or Adiabatic boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with an Outdoors boundary condition.

ground_construction.title: Ground Construction
ground_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Ground boundary condition.
